intro: Elatostema attenuatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of China, India, and Indonesia. Elatostema attenuatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
